@description.name: @description
@description.body:
A Spacer is a "virtual" widget, which can be placed into any layout and takes the space a normal widget of the same size would take. Spacers are invisible and very light weight because they don't require any DOM modifications. Example Here is a little example of how to use the widget. 

   var container = new qx.ui.container.Composite(new qx.ui.layout.HBox());
   container.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget());
   container.add(new qx.ui.core.Spacer(50));
   container.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget());

This example places two widgets and a spacer into a container with a horizontal box layout. In this scenario the spacer creates an empty area of 50 pixel width between the two widgets. External Documentation Documentation of this widget in the qooxdoo manual.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper method called from the visibility queue to detect outstanding changes to the appearance.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Recursively adds all children to the given queue

@param.name: @param
@param.body: queue {Map} The queue to add widgets to
@param.description: The queue to add widgets to

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes this widget from its parent and dispose it. Please note that the widget is not disposed synchronously. The real dispose happens after the next queue flush.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.
